text:
When installing Apache 2.0.44 I have found that it won't allow me to shut down 
apache. I go and say "Stop", using the apache monitor and also the programs 
listing, and it will say "Stopping all apache services" and then it sits there 
for hours on end and doesn't turn off. I really need a fix for this because it 
won't let me do a clean restart or shutdown without me having to do a "Endtask" 
command.
creator: a_arthur20@hotmail.com
nd@perlig.de
text: Does the problem persist in the current version (2.0.45)?

Ok. How did you start apache? via monitor? Is there anything interesting in the
errorlog? (try to raise the verbosity to LogLevel info or debug).
creator: nd@perlig.de
a_arthur20@hotmail.com
text:
Don't see any errors. It sits at the "The apache2 service is stopping" dos 
screen even if I leave it on all night.

creator: a_arthur20@hotmail.com
text:
It automatically runs on startup, and I can't even stop it via start menu or 
monitor.

creator: nd@perlig.de
text:
I'm not really familiar with the pseudo service thing on win9x...
But let's go further: How is it started? Via autostart entry in the start menu?
If yes, what are the properties of this entry?

Its started up when the pc boots up. Don't know the properties of this since 
apache set this by itself to do it.
creator: a_arthur20@hotmail.com
nd@perlig.de
text:
ok, let's try something simple. If this doesn't work, I'm giving up for now and
leave it for one with more knowledge on WinME (and a development enironment ...)

Open your dos-box and enter the apache bin directory while apache is running
(program files/apache group/apache2/bin or so); type

apache -k stop

Does this also hang forever?

Sorry that I couldn't help you so far.

It's a general Win9x bug, first reported for Apache 2.0.43 as bug #14555.

*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 14555 ***
creator: apache@janc.cjb.net
